text:
<@U7D5W6EVA> In order to have the "add a module" functionality inside the page editor you need to have at least 1 Flexible Column in the template ( <http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-modules#flexible-column> ). However, email (and blog) templates currently don't support Flexible Columns - I don't know if they ever will (perhaps a HubSpot rep here knows? :slightly_smiling_face: ).

If you want the user to be able to use the custom module several times inside the same email template, I would simply insert that module several times in the template and then inside the module add a boolean to allow the user to show/hide the module per instance.
Has anyone had an issue with sitesearch360 showing the same search results twice?

<@U4F337UM8> I think I’ve seen that happen before and I think it was because I had multiple search forms on the page. They recently(last week) pushed an updated version of their js file which solves a lot of bugs related to multiple search fields. think it’s v-9
<@U7SL518D6> Cool thanks for the advice. Will take a look
The updated script tag is listed in the installation guide page. It’s just the js library part you need to update, don’t think they deprecated anything so all your existing stuff should work
Does anyone know if/when the HubSpot forms markup changed in the last 6-8 months?
I've used sidr.js before
BUT I think this is a better option: <https://slideout.js.org/>
<@U24DCSJBE> would know

Hey all Question about the new design manager. I’m about to build out a redesign on an existing HS site, and want to use the new design manager for it, if I switch over, can I build new templates and whatnot without actually converting the old templates? my goal is to leave them be and not touch them. I however want to build the new site out using the new design manager.

<@U2691T2Q3> I don't believe anything has changed in the past 6-8 months, nothing major anyway. We've been making small improvements to accessibility on Forms, but that should have almost zero impact on the markup. Is there a reason you're asking? Notice anything in particular?
<@U24DCSJBE> Thanks for the info. We were having an issue with some error messages on a particular form, but have since resolved it.
Anyone know the answer to this?
yes, you can do that.
yes
you’ll have to let’s say manually clone the custom modules that you want to edit. but you can use the old ones as they are

Awesome, thank you guys I as worried I wouldn’t get to use the new toys on this project. It’s like going from a hack saw to a power saw, and then being told you may not have electricity at your next project
<@U2Q5LPHGS> Do you know how I can redirect a people based on his language (I’m definitly using HubSpot Translation System) ?
Is there a way to have a form that is submitted go right to a HubDB row?
without using api's and such, just a basic functionality in Form to HubDB?
What's the use case?
So essentially if you are looking to create say a job board, someone would fill out your form, the form details would then get sent to a HubDB row
and your normal HubL would output the loop of data and all that
same could go for using password protected pages to have "in house" forms for populating table data
I’m liking the second idea there a lot. (the first one I’d worry about possible abuse of the form.) :ear:
oh yea it would have to be protected in some way no doubt
definite abuse of forms the other way
Before launch they said this would have to be API driven until they felt this would fit a broader audience of HubSpot users
<@U3TR96G84> you should do it using the browser language and the cookies, and also with a language switcher for user if has another language in browser
Great use case AJ...
Thanks Thomas. Not sure why this wouldn't be available, it seems a huge missed opportunity. Thanks for the heads up.

business listings powered by hubdb would also be a use case when someone fills out the "add our business" form that automatically adds a row to the database. The specific pages i'm referring to where this would be useful... business listing powered by hubdb: <https://www.cmtc.com/made-in-california-profile> - and the landing page: <https://offers.cmtc.com/join-the-made-in-california-program>
You could probably do this with Zapier based on a form submission
Zapier is the way I was thinking as well
<@U2Q5LPHGS> do you know which cookie is used to allow me to change his value ?
